Pretty annoying isn't it?

If a picture is worth a thousand words, imagine a social media site making a user read a ten thousand page paper like that.

Throughout this hopefully time has been bent, but spatially it has been kept consistent. More content gets added at the bottom and a reader can simply scroll up to read previous sections. Scrolling down is what everyone expects and at this point is almost universal across all websites. What happens when lightning strikes the compass of this site and East is West and North is South? When space is messed with and traditional forms of navigation are no longer possible, how does one find the white whale of the next paragraph?
